question: When Buzz shows off in front of Woody for the first time, what phrase does he proudly use to describe his jump?
extraInfo: Buzz’s line became so iconic that Pixar reused it decades later in Lightyear.

question: In the monster world’s energy crisis, what do the yellow canisters actually store?
extraInfo: Pixar designed the scream canisters after scuba tanks and old vacuum tubes.

question: Out by the drop-off, what forbidden object does Nemo defiantly swim up to and touch?
extraInfo: “He touched the butt!” became one of Pixar’s most quoted kid-movie lines ever.

question: According to Edna Mode’s golden rule, what should superheroes absolutely never have?
extraInfo: Edna lists every tragic cape accident in hysterical detail—one of Pixar’s funniest scenes.

question: Chef Gusteau’s motto inspires Remy throughout the film—what is it?
extraInfo: Anton Ego’s final review redefines the motto and makes half the audience cry.

question: Inside the Pizza Planet machine, what do the green aliens worship like a divine force?
extraInfo: Their chant 'The Claw chooses who will go and who will stay' became a cult favorite.

question: In Ellie’s old Adventure Book, what page title devastates Carl when he sees it?
extraInfo: Many fans say the Adventure Book scene is Pixar’s hardest emotional punch ever.

question: What secret directive is the Axiom’s autopilot following that conflicts with WALL-E’s mission?
extraInfo: A113 is an inside joke referencing a CalArts classroom used by Disney and Pixar legends.

question: In the Land of the Dead, what must remain on the family ofrenda for a spirit to visit the living world?
extraInfo: Coco’s emotional punch comes from how memories keep people alive across generations.

question: What does Bing Bong sacrifice to help Joy escape from the Memory Dump?
extraInfo: Bing Bong’s final words—'Take her to the moon for me'—crushed millions of viewers.

question: What kind of vehicle is Mater, Lightning McQueen’s lovable best friend?
extraInfo: Mater became so popular he got his own spin-off shorts.

question: By the end of the film, what surprising discovery do Mike and Sulley make about children?
options: They produce more dreams than screams
Fear can be converted to energy faster
Monsters don't need doors at all
Laughter is far more powerful than screams
extraInfo: This twist flips the whole monster economy overnight—Mike even becomes the top comedian.

question: What trail does little Dory learn to follow so she can always find her way home?
extraInfo: The shell path becomes one of the film’s most emotional full-circle moments.

question: While flying with her kids, what shocking message does Elastigirl overhear from Syndrome’s missiles?
extraInfo: The raw panic in her voice during that scene is one of Pixar’s most intense moments.

question: What song does Miguel sing to help Coco remember her father?
extraInfo: Pixar storyboard artists cried during the first pitch of the 'Remember Me' scene.
